metadata.title: RHSA-2020:5528: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.4 security update on RHEL 8 (Low)
metadata.description:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This release of Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.4 on RHEL 8 serves as a replacement for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4.3, and includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the Release Notes document linked to in the References.

Security Fix(es):

* keycloak: Account REST API can update user metadata attributes (CVE-2020-27826)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: CVE-2020-27826 keycloak: Account REST API can update user metadata attributes

platform: Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.4 for RHEL 8

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is installed
rh-sso7-keycloak is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
rh-sso7-keycloak-server is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
